member.name: PROCESS_MITIGATION_DYNAMIC_CODE_POLICY
member.summary: Contains process mitigation policy settings for restricting dynamic code generation and modification.

member.name: PROCESS_MITIGATION_DYNAMIC_CODE_POLICY.DUMMYUNIONNAME.DUMMYSTRUCTNAME.ProhibitDynamicCode
member.summary: Set (0x1) to prevent the process from generating dynamic code or modifying existing executable code; otherwise leave unset (0x0).

member.name: PROCESS_MITIGATION_DYNAMIC_CODE_POLICY.DUMMYUNIONNAME.DUMMYSTRUCTNAME.AllowThreadOptOut
member.summary: Set (0x1) to allow threads to opt out of the restrictions on dynamic code generation by calling the function with the ThreadInformation parameter set to ThreadDynamicCodePolicy; otherwise leave unset (0x0). You should not use the AllowThreadOptOut and ThreadDynamicCodePolicy settings together to provide strong security. These settings are only intended to enable applications to adapt their code more easily for full dynamic code restrictions.

member.name: PROCESS_MITIGATION_DYNAMIC_CODE_POLICY.DUMMYUNIONNAME.DUMMYSTRUCTNAME.AllowRemoteDowngrade
member.summary: Set (0x1) to allow non-AppContainer processes to modify all of the dynamic code settings for the calling process, including relaxing dynamic code restrictions after they have been set.
